intro: Memecylon mayottense, commonly known as the Mayotte mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
